main event: On 7th July 1949, in Alexandria, Louisiana, a round, orange light was observed in the sky by multiple witnesses over a period of approximately 5 minutes. The object seemed to move from North to West before reversing its course and flying back North before fading from view gradually.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a basketball and then later described as about 6 inches in diameter, resembling an ordinary household light bulb.
It had no visible means of support or propulsion, and no evidence of exhaust or sound.
The object maintained a smooth, constant speed and did not vary in its luminosity or maneuvers.
Multiple witnesses corroborated the sighting, and attempts were made to check for other aircraft in the vicinity at the time of the event.

The observer was a housewife and practical nurse with a hobby of working with flowers, and she was regarded as having excellent ability to determine color, but she mentioned that she couldn't see without glasses.
